title: Garalde
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322042639/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Type and Lettering Styles](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322042639/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Type%20and%20Lettering%20Styles) : Garalde**

Late [Old Style](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322042639/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Old%20Style) type style of the baroque period. Like the [Venetian](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322042639/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Venetian) types, this style is based on [calligraphic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322042639/http:/typophile.com/wiki/calligraphy) principles, including modulated [stroke](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322042639/http:/typophile.com/wiki/stroke), oblique axis, [adnate](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322042639/http:/typophile.com/wiki/adnate) serifs and modeled terminals, and moderate [aperture](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322042639/http:/typophile.com/wiki/aperture). The Garalde [italics](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322042639/http:/typophile.com/wiki/italic) are closely associated with their corresponding [roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322042639/http:/typophile.com/wiki/roman) fonts and are designed to be used together with them in a subordinate role.

See also [Garalde Typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322042639/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Garalde%20Typefaces).
author: paul d hunt
